citations.narrative:
The licensee is not using the required APHIS Form 7006 for disposition records and does not have a variance. The
licensee is currently using computerized disposition records. The use of APHIS Form 7006 is required as it allows for
proper traceability and management of regulated animals at a facility.
Each dealer shall use Record of Disposition of Dogs and Cats (APHIS Form 7006) to make, keep, and maintain the
information required by paragraph (a)(1) of this section. Provided, that if a dealer or exhibitor who uses a computerized
recordkeeping system believes that APHIS Form 7006 are unsuitable for him or her to make, keep, and maintain the
information required by paragraph (a)(1) of this section, the dealer or exhibitor may request a variance from the
requirement to use APHIS Form 7006. Correct by ensuring all required information is fully and correctly documented on
an APHIS Form 7006 or by obtaining a variance. Correct by 6-June-2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
2.75(a)(2) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
The licensee is not using the required APHIS Form 7006 for disposition records and does not have a variance. The 
licensee is currently using computerized disposition records. The use of APHIS Form 7006 is required as it allows for 
proper traceability and management of regulated animals at a facility. 
 
Each dealer shall use Record of Disposition of Dogs and Cats (APHIS Form 7006) to make, keep, and maintain the 
information required by paragraph (a)(1) of this section. Provided, that if a dealer or exhibitor who uses a computerized 
recordkeeping system believes that APHIS Form 7006 are unsuitable for him or her to make, keep, and maintain the 
information required by paragraph (a)(1) of this section, the dealer or exhibitor may request a variance from the 
requirement to use APHIS Form 7006. Correct by ensuring all required information is fully and correctly documented on 
an APHIS Form 7006 or by obtaining a variance. Correct by 6-June-2023. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
